intro: Tristellateia stenactis subvar. bernieri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tristellateia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, finely divided leaves. The plant produces umbellate inflorescences with small white or pale yellow flowers. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
